document_title: Traumatic brain injury: Signs, causes and diagnosis
subsection_content:
Traumatic brain injury is a condition where a hard object impacts the head or the head hits a hard object. Penetrating injuries to the skull such as gunshot wounds or non-penetrating injuries such as being hit in the head in a car accident, etc. can lead to traumatic brain injury.
Mild traumatic brain injury can temporarily affect brain cells. More serious cases can lead to bruising, torn tissues, bleeding and other physical damage to the brain. Severe traumatic brain injury can lead to long-term complications or death.
Severe traumatic brain injury can cause death
subsection_title: chan thuong so nao.json. What is traumatic brain injury?
